Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @seantiz reported a bug where files weren't loading into the context after 11 requests and responses.
* The report lacks specific steps to reproduce the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Files not loading into the context after a certain number of requests.
* Difficulty in reproducing the issue due to lack of specific steps.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No specific solutions proposed or implemented in the conversation.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Users are experiencing performance issues with the Copilot feature, including slow response times and hangs.
* The issue appears to be related to a bug in the "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" functionality.
* A fix was implemented and released in version 10.0.2 of Pieces OS and version 3.0.2 of Pieces Desktop.

**Problems Identified:**

* Slow response times, particularly after using "Hard-Reset Active Runtime".
* In some cases, Copilot hangs indefinitely with "..." loading indicator.
* High CPU usage and blocked responses.
* Context files not being read.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A bug fix for the "Hard-Reset Active Runtime" functionality was implemented and released.
* Significant performance improvements were released in version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for some users, including those on Windows 11.
* However, some users are still experiencing performance issues after the latest updates.
* Further investigation and troubleshooting may be needed for those users still experiencing problems.

**Additional Information:**

* Users experiencing issues are encouraged to provide feedback to the Pieces team by scheduling a call or providing additional information about their specific situation.
* The issue was originally reported in July 2024 and the latest update was provided in March 2025.

* Wait for the next version of PiecesOS to be released for a permanent fix.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Unexpected Port Checks **Key Points:** * Pieces OS updates resulted in unexpected port checks. * These checks flood the developer console, causing confusion and interfering with debugging. * Even though the checks are privacy-safe, users found them invasive. * The issue may be due to a Chrome bug. **Problems Identified:** * Unexpected port checks clutter the developer console, making it difficult to distinguish real errors from phantom ones. * The port checks were perceived as invasive by some users. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Rutvik, a developer at Pieces, proposed hiding or better handling the errors from the port checks. * Rutvik later suggested checking the "Hide Network Messages" box in the developer console settings to prevent network logs. * The issue was ultimately fixed in version `4.0.4` of the Pieces web extension. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The port checks issue has been resolved with the latest update of the web extension. * Users should update to version `4.0.4` or later to avoid the issue. **Additional Notes:** * The possibility of the issue being caused by a Chrome bug was investigated but remained unresolved. * The developers remain committed to improving user experience by addressing concerns related to privacy and clarity.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation between brian-at-pieces and johnkennyuk

**Issue:** Johnkennyuk was encountering problems with Ollama on his Pieces OS, experiencing Cuda errors and conflicts between the Pieces OS Ollama instance and an externally installed one.

**Key points raised:**

* Johnkennyuk was experiencing Cuda errors with the Pieces OS Ollama instance.
* Pieces OS was attempting to start its own Ollama instance even though an external one was already running.
* Johnkennyuk suspected a race condition as the culprit.

**Problems identified:**

* Incomplete or broken Ollama installation.
* Conflicting Ollama instances leading to errors.
* Race condition causing Pieces OS to start its own Ollama instance despite the external one being active.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Uninstalling and reinstalling Ollama using OllamaSetup.exe.
* Checking the Path environment variable.
* Restarting Pieces OS and Ollama app in a specific order.
* Updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.2 which addressed the race condition.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue seems to be resolved after updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.2.
* Johnkennyuk will continue to monitor the situation and report any further occurrences.

**Additional notes:**

* Johnkennyuk suggested the capability for Pieces OS to detect and utilize an externally installed Ollama app instance.
* Brian-at-pieces confirmed this is possible and encouraged Johnkennyuk to reach out if the issue persists.

related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
